body_html:
In a perfect world, when a build failed I'd click some sort of link and see the error message for the failing test. As it is, I have no idea what's going wrong: the links either say "FAILED" with no information or include a huge wall of text none of which seems related to the tests which failed. I expect some but not all of it is my fault (locally I see a few tests fail which definitely aren't my fault). @ebrevdo: Could I get some help?

Giving up for the night, and based on recent history that may mean giving up for a week or two.

body:
In a perfect world, when a build failed I'd click some sort of link and see the error message for the failing test.  As it is, I have no idea what's going wrong: the links either say "FAILED" with no information or include a huge wall of text none of which seems related to the tests which failed.  I expect some but not all of it is my fault (locally I see a few tests fail which definitely aren't my fault).  @ebrevdo: Could I get some help?

Giving up for the night, and based on recent history that may mean giving up for a week or two.
